name: recut
content:
recut verb [T]
(WITH KNIFE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cut something with a knife or other sharp object again: The water in the vase should be changed regularly, and the flower stems recut each time. After a disastrous trip to the hairdresser, I got my hair recut, and now I love it!
More examplesFewer examplesCheeses are recut and repackaged all along the supply chain.The diamond was recut and polished in order to better view the specimen.This is a special tool used for recutting washer seats on taps and valves.

recut verb [T]
(FILM)
to cut a film (= remove unwanted parts or arrange the parts in a different way) again: There were rumours that the film was recut against the director's wishes. The movie - filmed in early 2001 - had to be recut in the wake of 9/11.
More examplesFewer examplesThey released a recut version of the film in 1951.She said "I'll take the movie away from you and recut it myself."The song had such an effect on the film that Lasseter went back into the movie and recut the sequence to Newman's lyrics.
